item.title: Lake Cargelligo residents in shock after three people shot dead
item.description: Residents of a remote NSW town of just 1,500 residents have expressed shock at a deadly shooting spree where three people were shot dead.

item.title: Friday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: To Lam wins second term to rule Vietnam through 2030
item.description: Vietnam's leader To Lam has been re-appointed as head of the ruling Communist Party for the next five years, and pledges to turbocharge growth in the export-reliant nation.

item.title: Lawyers call for Australian investigation into Israeli President Isaac Herzog amid genocide allegations
item.description: The Australian Centre for International Justice has formally requested a police investigation into Israel's president for alleged incitement to genocide. He is expected to visit to Australia next month.

item.title: West Coast Eagles player Tyler Brockman charged with assault after Geraldton fracas
item.description: West Coast Eagles player Tyler Brockman is charged with causing grievous bodily harm following an incident in Geraldton in late December.

item.title: Jake Fenner sentenced to three years in prison over father's death in Darwin
item.description: Jake Fenner, 32, has been handed a partially suspended sentence for causing the death of his father at their Moil home in 2023.

item.title: Drowning most likely cause of death of Canadian backpacker Piper James on K'gari, coroner says
item.description: A preliminary report from the Coroners Court of Queensland finds that while Piper James was bitten by dingoes before she died on K'gari, drowning is the most likely cause of death.

item.title: Steve Smith delivers again as Sixers down Hurricanes to cruise into BBL decider
item.description: Steve Smith top scores for the fifth time in as many innings as the Sixers down the Hurricanes to book a place in Sunday's BBL decider in Perth.

item.title: Hottest 100 quiz: How well do you remember past countdowns?
item.description: While you wait to hear who is number one this year, test your memory of past Hottest 100 countdowns.

item.title: As Russia's war intensifies Europe is exploring military and economic independence
item.description: As the world's elite gathered in Davos, European leaders confronted a reality in which they might need to defend themselves, and potentially against, the United States.

item.title: From ultimatum to implosion: How the Coalition went its separate ways
item.description: Dissecting the implosion of the Coalition and figuring out what comes next has become a full-time vocation for the newly emancipated Liberals and Nationals.

item.title: Prince Harry takes on the Daily Mail in High Court privacy showdown
item.description: The Duke of Sussex takes on the publisher he believes poisoned his childhood, his marriage, and his peace of mind in a legal battle driven by anger as well as principle.

item.title: Search for Julian Ingram enters third day following Lake Cargelligo shooting
item.description: A gunman accused of killing three people and seriously injuring another in New South Wales' Central West may be receiving help to evade authorities, police say.

item.title: Tropical Cyclone Luana forms into category one system off Kimberley coast
item.description: Residents in WA's West Kimberley are being warned to prepare for days of wild weather, with a tropical cyclone forming up off the region's coast.

item.title: Australia smash Sri Lanka by nine wickets to stay unbeaten at Under-19s Cricket World Cup
item.description: Australia have continued their dominant run through the Under-19s Cricket World Cup with Will Byrom's 5-14 leading the way in a nine-wicket win over Sri Lanka in their final group match.

item.title: Australian Neo-Nazis use symbols that may evade hate speech laws
item.description: Viking symbols and a Norwegian jacket have now become synonymous with Australia's Neo-Nazi groups, but what do they mean?

item.title: Track temperatures as heatwave sweeps across continent over Australia Day weekend
item.description: Use our tracker to keep an eye on temperatures as a heatwave moves across much of the country.

item.title: Worst crown-of-thorns starfish outbreak in decades emerging on Great Barrier Reef
item.description: Scientists are rushing to contain an emerging outbreak of coral-eating crown-of-thorns starfish on the Great Barrier Reef, warning it could be one of the worst in 60 years.

item.title: SA heatwave leads to total fire bans, catastrophic conditions and Tour Down Under changes
item.description: South Australia's hottest weather in six years creates dangerous bushfire conditions, which the head of the Country Fire Service says are "as serious as it gets".

item.title: Triggering a heatwave takes more than just temperature — as Australia braces for another
item.description: Yet another major heatwave is sweeping across south-eastern Australia. But what actually triggers the warning? Spoiler alert: hitting 40C is not enough.

item.title: Majority of NSW beaches shut amid shark attacks to reopen for Australia Day long weekend
item.description: Heatwave conditions and Australia Day long weekend activities are expected to draw crowds back to the water after a dangerous 48 hours on the New South Wales coast.

item.title: Ross River Virus cases quadruple in South Australia in 2025
item.description: There were more than four times the number of Ross River Virus cases in South Australia in 2025 compared to 2024, prompting a new public health awareness campaign.

item.title: How a tank of zebrafish helped two children born with a rare genetic variant
item.description: With a tank of zebrafish, Queensland researcher Jean Giacomotto was able to test a never-before seen genetic variant affecting two babies.

item.description: Police are searching for a woman after a man suffered serious injuries in a stabbing at North Wonthaggi in the early hours of Saturday morning.

item.title: Future of Canberra's Black Mountain Tower in limbo as Ngunnawal cultural site plans stall
item.description: Custodians say they have been excluded from talks between Telstra and the ACT government about plans to develop the iconic tower into a Ngunnawal cultural site.

item.title: Gen Z led the revolution in Bangladesh — can they win the election?
item.description: After toppling Sheikh Hasina, Bangladesh's newest political party faces its first election next month, testing a newly formed alliance.

item.description: In an increasingly complex financial world of buy-now-pay-later schemes, scams, and social media marketing, there are renewed calls for financial literacy to become a mandatory part of the school curriculum.

item.description: For First Nations recruits the path to firefighting is demanding, competitive and often deeply personal.

item.description: A mining company in Western Australia's Pilbara region is one step closer to decarbonising its iron ore production after starting construction on the region's first wind farm.

item.description: As Myanmar's military junta seeks international legitimacy through elections, its brutal repression of the pro-democracy movement is radicalising a new generation of activists.

item.description: How the first Big Day Out in 1992 turned a risky idea into a landmark moment in Australian music history.

item.description: The average age of purchasing your first home is increasing as economists say politicians continue to favour the current home owner.

item.description: Novak Djokovic shows once again that his relationship with Australian tennis fans is as complicated as it gets, turning a routine win into a full-blown drama.

item.title: Former state care kid calls for fundamental change to fix 'broken' residential care system

item.description: Like Donald Bradman’s tank stand, the backyard tennis court of Rod Laver’s youth has survived against the odds, but it is yet to be heritage listed.

item.title: Man dies after confrontation with police officers in Kalgoorlie
item.description: A 43-year-old man has died after an incident involving WA Police officers in South Kalgoorlie.

item.title: Gunmen open fire at soccer field in central Mexico, killing 11
item.description: Authorities say gunmen opened fire in the city of Salamanca, killing at least 11 people and wounding 12 at the end of a soccer match.

item.title: Government agency deliberately broke law for years, federal watchdog finds
item.description: Services Australia has known it was not fully complying with new child support laws since 2019, according to a scathing report released by the Commonwealth Ombudsman.

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu announces discovery of remains of last Israeli hostage in Gaza, Ran Gvili
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says the remains of Ran Gvili have been found and identified.

item.title: Donald Trump sends 'border czar' Tom Homan to Minnesota after shooting of nurse Alex Pretti
item.description: An American citizen, Alex Pretti, was shot by federal agents during a continuing Trump administration immigration crackdown in the city.

item.title: Indonesian marines among at least 42 people missing in West Java landslide
item.description: The search is ongoing for survivors after the pre-dawn landslide on the slopes of Mount Burangrang in West Java province killed at least two dozen people at the weekend.

item.title: Major winter storm kills dozens of people across the US
item.description: Almost 200 million Americans are under cold weather alerts as snow, sleet and freezing rain affects swathes of the country from Texas to New England, with temperatures set to fall dangerously low this week.

item.title: Russia, Ukraine and US plan further trilateral talks on ending war
item.description: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says discussions between envoys from Ukraine, Russia and the US in Abu Dhabi last week aimed at ending Moscow's invasion have left some political issues unresolved.

item.title: Victoria on high alert amid extreme bushfire danger and soaring temperatures
item.description: Firefighters warn a wind change is likely to worsen Otways blaze, while temperature records tumble across the state.

item.title: Hoping to start your finances afresh in 2026? These tips will help
item.description: It might be time to devote some of your energy and good intentions towards your finances.

item.title: Track temperatures live as heatwave hits multiple states
item.description: Use our tracker to keep an eye on temperatures as a heatwave moves across much of the country.

item.title: What does the probe into senior military officials in China mean for Xi Jinping?
item.description: Another two senior generals are under investigation for alleged corruption in China and that has big consequences for President Xi Jinping.

item.title: Australian Open quarterfinalist Alex de Minaur confident he can compete against Carlos Alcaraz
item.description: World number one Carlos Alcaraz has defeated Alex de Minaur each time they have played, but the Australian is not overawed ahead of their quarterfinal clash.

item.title: China's aging population is saving its way towards economic stagnation
item.description: Unlike many Western economies, Chinese households stash away more than 40 per cent of their income. But the pressure to boost local consumption is mounting for Beijing.

item.title: Darderi's tantrum against Sinner, and Ostapenko nails opponent in the face — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: Sabalenka and Alcaraz denied fitness tracking devices, Darderi has a tantrum and Siegemund cops a tennis ball to the face. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

item.title: Travel quiz: How well do you know your way around the world?
item.description: Which food is thrown in the re-enactment of a medieval food fight? And which airport is the world's busiest?

item.title: Maddison Inglis exits Australian Open after loss to Iga Świątek in fourth round
item.description: Maddison Inglis did not expect to reach the Australian Open fourth round, while she reveals the unusual items she wants to buy with her prize money.

item.title: TikTok account celebrating Bondi terrorist attack was active for a month before deletion
item.description: The social media giant deleted the account and a host of other profiles promoting Islamic State and other violent ideology only after questioning by the ABC last week.

item.title: Vivienne Westwood and Rei Kawakubo's fashion designs bring punk, play and power to new exhibition at the NGV
item.description: The revolutionary work of fashion designers Vivienne Westwood and Rei Kawakubo is celebrated with style, surprise and punk flair in this new exhibition.

item.title: Hellyer gold mine's previous operator has gone into liquidation
item.description: Hellyer Metals, which until recently operated Tasmania's Hellyer gold mine, has gone into liquidation. But the company says the mine is unaffected because it is now operated by a different company.

item.title: US criminal investigation in 'legal limbo' as wanted man sighted in Australian coastal towns
item.description: Texan authorities say an extradition order may be required to resolve the "legal limbo" involving Australian man Izaak Michell.

item.title: A peaceful gathering in Perth's CBD turns to chaos in a matter of seconds. So what really happened?
item.description: Premier Roger Cook says the way an orderly protest was targeted "runs against the very heart of what it means to be Australian". So what really happened in Perth's CBD on Australia Day?

item.title: Getting ready for the first day of school looks very different across Australia
item.description: Families across the country, from the coast to the outback, are gearing up to return to school after a long, hot summer.

item.title: Live: Ley backer insists leadership speculation 'all sound and fury signifying nothing'
item.description: A backer of Sussan Ley has taken aim at the fevered speculation about a looming Liberal leadership challenge, dismissing it as "sound and fury signifying nothing". Follow live.

item.title: Live: Australian share market rallies to three-month high
item.description: The ASX 200 has held onto its gains through the session, trading higher as gold and silver surge in price. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Man charged with rape and attempted murder after alleged attack at Yeppen Lagoon
item.description: A 27-year-old man remains in custody after the alleged attack of a woman on a run in Rockhampton.

item.title: Woman discovers Holocaust descendants through DNA testing
item.description: Adriana Turk grew up believing there were no survivors on her Jewish father's side after World War II, but a DNA test showed that was not the case.

item.title: Kumanjayi Dempsey's family speak out after 'devastating' Tennant Creek death in custody
item.description: The family of a woman who recently died inside an NT police watch house is calling for answers, asking why she wasn't checked by medical staff for nearly two days, and demanding immediate action to improve conditions.

item.title: Noosa houseboats forced off river as new maritime rules take effect
item.description: A David and Goliath battle is playing out on the multi-million-dollar shores of the Noosa River, where dozens of houseboat residents say they are being forced out and potentially into financial ruin.

item.title: Trump suggests he may rein in Minnesota ICE operation amid public outrage
item.description: The Trump administration indicates it could rein in its Minnesota immigration crackdown as public outrage intensifies after a federal agent killed a protester.

item.title: Two people die in light plane crash near private Gold Coast airstrip
item.description: Police say the plane crashed shortly after take-off from the private airstrip, killing two men and sparking a large fire.

item.title: Emergency feed arrives for remote WA pastoralists amid worst drought in decades
item.description: Volunteer truck drivers and farmers rally to deliver tonnes of hay, providing relief for livestock and pastoralists in a remote part of Western Australia quietly struggling with drought.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Phoebe Heaydon, Madison Hoffman, Harry Laidlaw final members of Australian Milan-Cortina team
item.description: Alpine skiers Phoebe Heaydon, Madison Hoffman and Harry Laidlaw are added to Australia's 53-strong Winter Olympics team, which started to arrive in Italy.

item.title: Sir Donald Bradman's baggy green fetches record price at auction
item.description: A baggy green cap worn by Don Bradman in the 1947-48 series against India has been sold for $460,000 at auction.

item.title: SA divers have close encounter with great white shark, as local sightings grow
item.description: The sighting comes amid a spate of white shark reports in SA's south east, and after a tragic month of incidents in NSW.

item.title: Live: Emergency warnings for Victorian fires, as heatwave sends temperatures soaring
item.description: A record-breaking heatwave is impacting south-east Australia, with temperature records tumbling in parts of Victoria and South Australia. Follow our live coverage.

item.title: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Luana brings rare swell to Broome's wave-starved surfers
item.description: Desperate surfers flock to Broome's Gantheaume Beach to catch some rarely seen waves brought by ex-Tropical Cyclone Luana.

item.title: Overland Telegraph Line documentary features First Nations accounts of violence
item.description: Aboriginal filmmaker Kieran Satour's documentary tells of murders and massacres by settlers and First Nations people during construction of the Overland Telegraph Line.

item.title: Race to save 'zombie tree' as scientists fight to stop living species from dying out
item.description: Scientists and nursery workers race to save a newly identified tree species in Queensland branded "living dead", after a fungal disease stopped it from growing or reproducing in the wild.

item.title: Live: 20yo American pushing Australian Open finalist in epic quarter
item.description: Near record temperatures are forecast for day 10 of the Australian Open, featuring the start of the singles quarterfinals, with Alex de Minaur and top seed Carlos Alcaraz the main event. Follow live.

item.title: How the Perth Scorchers sit alone as Australia's greatest Big Bash League franchise
item.description: Six titles in 15 seasons is an extraordinary record, but what is the secret of the Perth Scorchers' incredible success?

item.title: Rescue dog used in central Queensland koala monitoring program
item.description: This scruffy pup has gone from the pound to being part of a scat detection dog team, helping save endangered koalas.

item.title: Canberra man charged over alleged hit and run on NSW South Coast that left teenager in critical condition
item.description: Police allege the 27-year-old tested positive for cocaine and ecstasy, and returned an alcohol breath test above the legal limit.

item.title: Kanye West takes out Wall Street Journal ad to apologise for antisemitism
item.description: Ye, the artist formerly known as Kanye West, has taken out a full-page ad in the Wall Street Journal to apologise for past behaviour, saying he had an undiagnosed brain injury and bipolar disorder.

item.title: Man charged with making explosives after Perth Invasion Day incident
item.description: A 31-year-old man is charged with making explosives in suspicious circumstances after a device was allegedly thrown into a crowd of hundreds of people attending an Invasion Day rally in central Perth yesterday.

item.title: NT government mandates national anthem be sung at public school assemblies
item.description: Under a policy introduced today, Northern Territory public schools will be directed to play both verses of the anthem during school assemblies and special events.

item.title: Melbourne boy Danny, 12, missing from Venus Bay beach presumed dead
item.description: A search for a 12-year-old boy missing at a South Gippsland beach has shifted to a recovery operation.

item.title: Maddison and Teagan Levi opt out of NRLW switch to re-sign with Rugby Australia on two-year deal
item.description: Maddison and Teagan Levi have turned down a potential switch to the NRLW and re-signed with Rugby Australia in an effort to claim rugby sevens gold at the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics.

item.title: The school holidays are over, how's your bedtime routine looking?
item.description: Has your bedtime routine gone out the window over the school holidays? We've got you covered with these expert tips.

item.title: Flash flooding on Copperfield River forces emergency evacuation of Einasleigh
item.description: Etheridge Shire Council in Far North Queensland issues an Emergency Warning for Einasleigh township residents to evacuate.

item.title: Brandan Koschel denied bail over alleged hate speech at March for Australia rally
item.description: Brandan Koschel has been charged with publicly inciting hatred on the grounds of race causing fear after he made comments at an open mic session at the rally.

item.title: Japan says goodbye to its last pandas as relations with Beijing deteriorate
item.description: The departure of the last pandas from Japan demonstrates a significant crisis in North-East Asian politics that has no resolution on the horizon.

item.title: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter joins calls to boycott men's World Cup games in US
item.description: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter is backing a proposed fan boycott of men's World Cup matches in the United States because of the conduct of President Donald Trump and his administration.

item.title: Should you leave the air con on for your pets?
item.description: Do you wonder what your pet gets up to at home when you're not there? With temperatures on the rise, we asked three experts about keeping them cool in the heat.

item.title: Sink or Swim | Michael Klim
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Flooding around Einasleigh township.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Sydney men granted bail after alleged attempt to smuggle 65 kilograms of heroin into Australia
item.description: Police allege officers found an estimated 65 kilograms of white powder, which returned a positive result for heroin.

item.title: Wine, spirit and juice bottles to be added to Canberra's container deposit scheme
item.description: The ACT will expand its 10-cent container deposit scheme, with the changes expected to result in an additional 8 million containers being recycled in the first year.

item.title: Mandurah teacher who had student's baby pleads guilty to sexual abuse
item.description: A WA teacher pleads guilty to sexually abusing a boy who police say fathered her baby.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Time-lapse of winter storm at New York's Times Square
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Donald Trump triggers a gold rush as investors flee the United States
item.description: While the surging gold price has been a surprise, the driving forces behind it are not. Investors are losing faith in the United States and its role as the standard-bearer for global capitalism.

item.title: Victorian maximum temperature record broken as heatwave engulfs Australia
item.description: Temperatures soar to record highs across Victoria's north-west, as a heatwave pushes town gauges beyond previous records.

item.title: Charges withdrawn against seven men accused of illegally trafficking abalone on NSW South Coast
item.description: Seven Aboriginal men from the NSW South Coast, accused of illegally trafficking thousands of blacklip abalone, walk free after police prosecutors withdraw all charges.

item.title: Riverland town rises above 49C in 'new all-time record' for Renmark
item.description: South Australia's Riverland region is enduring sweltering conditions, with the temperature soaring above 49C in what the weather bureau says is "a new all-time record for Renmark".

item.title: Three families on how they manage multi-generational living
item.description: Cost-of-living and housing affordability issues are bringing generations together under the same roof, but some families are doing it by choice.

item.title: Joshua Stephen Davey faces court charged with importing nitazenes from UK
item.description: Nowra man Joshua Stephen Davey faces court after an investigation into "small round blue pills" allegedly found by Border Force in a package being sent to the South Coast from the UK.
